p: CMMs harvested during different growing periods contain different plant metabolites. For instance, the content of essential oil increased as the age of P. cablin increased: patchoulol, Î±-bulnesene and other sesquiterpenes accumulated to high concentrations at 210 days after maturation [ 24]. According to the report from Jin et al. [ 25], Chaenomeles speciosa (Sweet) Nakai produced the highest quality yields when harvested in early July. In the case of Desmodium styracifolium (Osb.) Merr., the best collection season was early October, when the highest concentrations of polysaccharides, flavonoids and schaftoside were measured [ 26].
